ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would absolutely recommend this class to anyone interested in African American literature and/or history. It is a fantastic and really unique opportunity to delve into one writer's work, rather than trying to speed through an overwhelming number of texts in a single semester. Professor Stepto is wonderful.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class enhanced my knowledge of both Ralph Ellison's work and (as the title promises!) the larger cultural contexts in which he worked. This approach invites engagement with a variety of facets of twentieth-century American cultural and literary history. The course definitely helped me think in more detail about the themes I want to pursue in my further research.
